df-uhgr
blocks.content: Define the class of all undirected hypergraphs. An undirected hypergraph consists of a set ` v ` (of "vertices") and a function ` e ` (representing indexed "edges") into the power set of this set (the empty set excluded). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 8-Oct-2020.)

blocks.name: df-ushgr
blocks.content: Define the class of all undirected simple hypergraphs. An undirected simple hypergraph is a special (non-simple, multiple, multi-) hypergraph for which the edge function ` e ` is an injective (one-to-one) function into subsets of the set of vertices ` v ` , representing the (one or more) vertices incident to the edge. This definition corresponds to the definition of hypergraphs in section I.1 of [Bollobas] p. 7 (except that the empty set seems to be allowed to be an "edge") or section 1.10 of [Diestel] p. 27, where "E is a subset of [[...] the power set of V, that is the set of all subsets of V" resp. "the elements of E are nonempty subsets (of any cardinality) of V". (Contributed by AV, 19-Jan-2020.) (Revised by AV, 8-Oct-2020.)

  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ciedg, c0))
} = {
  syl5bb(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, cuhgr), wf(c2, cdm(c2), cdif(cpw(c3), csn(emptycls))), wcel(c0, cab(hs2, wsbc(hs1, cfv(cvtx, cv(hs2)), wsbc(hs0, cfv(ciedg, cv(hs2)), wf(cv(hs0), cdm(cv(hs0)), cdif(cpw(cv(hs1)), csn(emptycls))))))))
  eleq2i(c0, cuhgr, cab(hs2, wsbc(hs1, cfv(cvtx, cv(hs2)), wsbc(hs0, cfv(ciedg, cv(hs2)), wf(cv(hs0), cdm(cv(hs0)), cdif(cpw(cv(hs1)), csn(emptycls)))))))
  df-uhgr(hs2, hs1, hs0)

  feq123d(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs3)), cdm(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs3))), cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, cv(hs3))), csn(emptycls)), c2, cdm(c2), cdif(cpw(c3), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs3), c0))
  syl6eqr(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs3)), c2, cfv(ciedg, c0), wceq(cv(hs3), c0))
  syl6eq(cdm(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs3))), cdm(c2), cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wceq(cv(hs3), c0))

  pweqd(cfv(cvtx, cv(hs3)), c3, wceq(cv(hs3), c0))
  syl6eqr(cfv(cvtx, cv(hs3)), c3, cfv(cvtx, c0), wceq(cv(hs3), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs3), c0, cvtx)
  cbvabv(hs2, hs3, wsbc(hs1, cfv(cvtx, cv(hs2)), wsbc(hs0, cfv(ciedg, cv(hs2)), wf(cv(hs0), cdm(cv(hs0)), cdif(cpw(cv(hs1)), csn(emptycls))))), wf(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs3)), cdm(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs3))), cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, cv(hs3))), csn(emptycls))))
  sbcied2(hs1, cfv(cvtx, cv(hs2)), universe, cfv(cvtx, cv(hs3)), wceq(cv(hs2), cv(hs3)), wsbc(hs0, cfv(ciedg, cv(hs2)), wf(cv(hs0), cdm(cv(hs0)), cdif(cpw(cv(hs1)), csn(emptycls)))), wf(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs3)), cdm(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs3))), cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, cv(hs3))), csn(emptycls))))
  fvexd(cvtx, cv(hs2), wceq(cv(hs2), cv(hs3)))
  fveq2(cv(hs2), cv(hs3), cvtx)
  sbcied2(hs0, cfv(ciedg, cv(hs2)), universe, cfv(ciedg, cv(hs3)), wa(wceq(cv(hs2), cv(hs3)), wceq(cv(hs1), cfv(cvtx, cv(hs3)))), wf(cv(hs0), cdm(cv(hs0)), cdif(cpw(cv(hs1)), csn(emptycls))), wf(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs3)), cdm(cfv(ciedg, cv(hs3))), cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, cv(hs3))), csn(emptycls))))
  fvexd(ciedg, cv(hs2), wa(wceq(cv(hs2), cv(hs3)), wceq(cv(hs1), cfv(cvtx, cv(hs3)))))

thm isuhgr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ∈ UHGraph ↔(c2 : dom(c2)→(P(c3)\ { ∅ }))))
  ⊣ c3 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ⊣ c2 =(iEdg ` c0)
} = {
  syl5bb(c0 ∈ c1, c0 ∈ UHGraph, (c2 : dom(c2)→(P(c3)\ { ∅ })), c0 ∈ { hs2 |[(Vtx ` hs2)/ hs1][(iEdg ` hs2)/ hs0](hs0 : dom(hs0)→(P(hs1)\ { ∅ }))})
  eleq2i(c0, cuhgr, { hs2 |[(Vtx ` hs2)/ hs1][(iEdg ` hs2)/ hs0](hs0 : dom(hs0)→(P(hs1)\ { ∅ }))})
  df-uhgr(hs2, hs1, hs0)
  elab2g(hs3, c0, c1, { hs2 |[(Vtx ` hs2)/ hs1][(iEdg ` hs2)/ hs0](hs0 : dom(hs0)→(P(hs1)\ { ∅ }))}, (c2 : dom(c2)→(P(c3)\ { ∅ })), ((iEdg ` hs3): dom((iEdg ` hs3))→(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })))
  feq123d((iEdg ` hs3), dom((iEdg ` hs3)), (P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ }), c2, dom(c2), (P(c3)\ { ∅ }), hs3 = c0)
  syl6eqr((iEdg ` hs3), c2, (iEdg ` c0), hs3 = c0)
  syl6eq(dom((iEdg ` hs3)), dom(c2), dom((iEdg ` c0)), hs3 = c0)
  dmeqd((iEdg ` hs3), (iEdg ` c0), hs3 = c0)
  fveq2(hs3, c0, ciedg)
  dmeqi((iEdg ` c0), c2)
  eqcomi((iEdg ` c0), c2)
  difeq1d(P((Vtx ` hs3)), { ∅ }, P(c3), hs3 = c0)
  pweqd((Vtx ` hs3), c3, hs3 = c0)
  syl6eqr((Vtx ` hs3), c3, (Vtx ` c0), hs3 = c0)
  fveq2(hs3, c0, cvtx)
  cbvabv(hs2, hs3, [(Vtx ` hs2)/ hs1][(iEdg ` hs2)/ hs0](hs0 : dom(hs0)→(P(hs1)\ { ∅ })), ((iEdg ` hs3): dom((iEdg ` hs3))→(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })))
  sbcied2(hs1, (Vtx ` hs2), universe, (Vtx ` hs3), hs2 = hs3, [(iEdg ` hs2)/ hs0](hs0 : dom(hs0)→(P(hs1)\ { ∅ })), ((iEdg ` hs3): dom((iEdg ` hs3))→(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })))
  fvexd(cvtx, hs2, hs2 = hs3)
  fveq2(hs2, hs3, cvtx)
  sbcied2(hs0, (iEdg ` hs2), universe, (iEdg ` hs3), (hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3)), (hs0 : dom(hs0)→(P(hs1)\ { ∅ })), ((iEdg ` hs3): dom((iEdg ` hs3))→(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })))
  fvexd(ciedg, hs2, (hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3)))
  adantr(hs2 = hs3, hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3), (iEdg ` hs2)=(iEdg ` hs3))
  fveq2(hs2, hs3, ciedg)
  feq123d(hs0, dom(hs0), (P(hs1)\ { ∅ }), (iEdg ` hs3), dom((iEdg ` hs3)), (P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ }), ((hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3))∧ hs0 =(iEdg ` hs3)))
  dmeqd(hs0, (iEdg ` hs3), ((hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3))∧ hs0 =(iEdg ` hs3)))
  simpr((hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3)), hs0 =(iEdg ` hs3))
  adantr((hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3)), hs0 =(iEdg ` hs3), (P(hs1)\ { ∅ })=(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ }))
  difeq1d(P(hs1), { ∅ }, P((Vtx ` hs3)), (hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3)))
  pweqd(hs1, (Vtx ` hs3), (hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3)))
  simpr(hs2 = hs3, hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3))
  diff.hs2.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs2.s(hs1)
  diff.hs3.c(c0)
  diff.hs3.w((c2 : dom(c2)→(P(c3)\ { ∅ })))
  diff.hs2.s(hs3)
  diff.hs2.w(((iEdg ` hs3): dom((iEdg ` hs3))→(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })))
  diff.hs3.w([(Vtx ` hs2)/ hs1][(iEdg ` hs2)/ hs0](hs0 : dom(hs0)→(P(hs1)\ { ∅ })))
  diff.hs1.c((Vtx ` hs2))
  diff.hs1.w(hs2 = hs3)
  diff.hs1.w(((iEdg ` hs3): dom((iEdg ` hs3))→(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })))
  diff.hs0.c((iEdg ` hs2))
  diff.hs0.w((hs2 = hs3 ∧ hs1 =(Vtx ` hs3)))
  diff.hs0.w(((iEdg ` hs3): dom((iEdg ` hs3))→(P((Vtx ` hs3))\ { ∅ })))
}

blocks.name: uhgrun
blocks.content: The union ` U ` of two (undirected) hypergraphs ` G ` and ` H ` with the same vertex set ` V ` is a hypergraph with the vertex ` V ` and the union ` ( E u. F ) ` of the (indexed) edges. (Contributed by AV, 11-Oct-2020.) (Revised by AV, 24-Oct-2021.)

thm uhgrun(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {

  mpbird(w0, wcel(c0, cuhgr), wf(cfv(ciedg, c0), cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c0)), csn(emptycls))))

  uhgrf(c1, c3, c5)
  mpbird(w0, wf(c4, cdm(c4), cdif(cpw(c5), csn(emptycls))), wf(c4, cdm(c4), cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c2)), csn(emptycls))))
  syl(w0, wf(c4, cdm(c4), cdif(cpw(cfv(cvtx, c2)), csn(emptycls))), wcel(c2, cuhgr))

  difeq1d(cpw(c5), csn(emptycls), cpw(cfv(cvtx, c2)), w0)

  syl6eq(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), cun(cdm(c3), cdm(c4)), cdm(cun(c3, c4)), w0)

thm uhgrun(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ UHGraph)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ UHGraph)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ UHGraph)
  ⊣ c3 =(iEdg ` c1)

  syl6eq(dom((iEdg ` c0)), (dom(c3)⋃ dom(c4)), dom((c3 ⋃ c4)), w0)
  dmeqd((iEdg ` c0), (c3 ⋃ c4), w0)

blocks.name: uhgrunop
blocks.content: The union of two (undirected) hypergraphs (with the same vertex set) represented as ordered pair: If ` <. V , E >. ` and ` <. V , F >. ` are hypergraphs, then ` <. V , E u. F >. ` is a hypergraph (the vertex set stays the same, but the edges from both graphs are kept, possibly resulting in two edges between two vertices). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 27-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 11-Oct-2020.) (Revised by AV, 24-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm uhgrunop(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cop(c0, cun(c1, c2)), cuhgr))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cuhgr))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(ciedg, c3))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ciedg, c4))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cvtx, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cvtx, c4), c0))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cin(cdm(c1), cdm(c2)), emptycls))
} = {
  uhgrun(cop(c0, cun(c1, c2)), c3, c4, c1, c2, c0, universe, w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(cop(c0, cun(c1, c2)), universe))
  opex(c0, cun(c1, c2))
  mp1i(w0, wceq(cfv(cvtx, cop(c0, cun(c1, c2))), c0), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(cun(c1, c2), universe)))
  opvtxfv(c0, universe, cun(c1, c2), universe)
  mp1i(w0, wceq(cfv(ciedg, cop(c0, cun(c1, c2))), cun(c1, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(cun(c1, c2), universe)))
  pm3.2i(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(cun(c1, c2), universe))
  fvexi(c0, cvtx, c3)
  unex(c1, c2)
  fvexi(c1, ciedg, c3)
  fvexi(c2, ciedg, c4)
  opiedgfv(c0, universe, cun(c1, c2), universe)
}

thm uhgrunop(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → < c0,(c1 ⋃ c2)> ∈ UHGraph)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ UHGraph)
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ UHGraph)

blocks.name: ushgrun
blocks.content: The union ` U ` of two (undirected) simple hypergraphs ` G ` and ` H ` with the same vertex set ` V ` is a (not necessarily simple) hypergraph with the vertex ` V ` and the union ` ( E u. F ) ` of the (indexed) edges. (Contributed by AV, 29-Nov-2020.) (Revised by AV, 24-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: ushgrunop
blocks.content: The union of two (undirected) simple hypergraphs (with the same vertex set) represented as ordered pair: If ` <. V , E >. ` and ` <. V , F >. ` are simple hypergraphs, then ` <. V , E u. F >. ` is a (not necessarily simple) hypergraph - the vertex set stays the same, but the edges from both graphs are kept, possibly resulting in two edges between two vertices. (Contributed by AV, 29-Nov-2020.) (Revised by AV, 24-Oct-2021.)

}

blocks.name: incistruhgr
blocks.content: An _incidence structure_ ` <. P , L , I >. ` "where ` P ` is a set whose elements are called _points_, ` L ` is a distinct set whose elements are called _lines_ and ` I C_ ( P X. L ) ` is the _incidence relation_" (see Wikipedia "Incidence structure" (24-Oct-2020), ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incidence_structure ) implies an undirected hypergraph, if the incidence relation is right-total (to exclude empty edges). The points become the vertices, and the edge function is derived from the incidence relation by mapping each line ("edge") to the set of vertices incident to the line/edge. With ` P = ( Base `` S ) ` and by defining two new slots for lines and incidence relations (analogous to ` LineG ` and ` Itv ` ) and enhancing the definition of ` iEdg ` accordingly, it would even be possible to express that a corresponding incidence structure _is_ an undirected hypergraph. By choosing the incident relation appropriately, other kinds of undirected graphs (pseudographs, multigraphs, simple graphs, etc.) could be defined. (Contributed by AV, 24-Oct-2020.)
